Brandon Baden, F-16 Viper Demo Maintenance Team Lead, USAF. Shaw AFB. MISSION To deliver a wholesome family entertainment event celebrating aviation past, present, and inspiring the future. VISION An unlimited passion for aviation and space drives FIAS to provide exciting military and civilian performances and displays for audiences of all ages. IMPACT The Florida International Air Show (FIAS) organization is a Florida 501c4 nonprofit corporation staffed entirely by volunteers. The air show is a multi-day event showcasing nationally known performers and exciting static displays of aircraft and vehicles. The air shows offer opportunities for attendees to learn more about aviation, space, and military services. READ MORE Warbird Thunder to Appear at the Florida International Air Show, November 1-2, 2025 September 8, 2025 Punta Gorda, FL —                                               The Florida International Air Show is thrilled to welcome                                              Warbird Thunder                                               to its 2025 lineup, scheduled for                                              November 1–2                                               at the Punta Gorda Airport. This marks an electrifying return of the North American SNJ Texan — also known as “Ol Growler” — to Southwest Florida’s skies.                                                                                                 Warbird Thunder promises an awe-inspiring aerial performance, featuring two SNJ Texans soaring in formation with their signature roar, smoke trails, and engaging aerobatic maneuvers like formation loops, aileron rolls, barrel rolls, and Cuban Eights. The show concludes with stunning opposing aerobatics as the planes separate and then reunite for a dramatic finale.                                                                                                  “Warbird Thunder brings a unique mix of history, heritage, and heart-stopping aerobatics,” said                                              Denise Dull, President of the Florida International Air Show                                  . “When those Texans thunder overhead, it’s not just entertainment — it’s a living tribute to the aviators who paved the way for modern flight. We are honored to share that experience with our community.”                                                                                     Highlights of the 2025 Florida International Air Show include:                                                                                 Dynamic performances by the                                                  U.S. Navy Blue Angels                                                   and the                                                  F-16 Viper Demo Team                                                                         A versatile roster of acts, including                                                  Aarron Deliu                                                   ,                                                  Doug Litton                                                   , and                                                  The Chuters                                                   Jump Team                                                                                      Exciting new experiences like the                                                  Innovators STEM Pavilion                                                   and the                                                  Family Aviation Experience                                     , both designed to engage and inspire audiences of all ages.                                                                                                              Tickets On Sale Now:                                              floridaairshow.com                                                                                                  For media inquiries, sponsorship opportunities, or vendor information, contact                                              media@floridaairshow.com                                               or call                                              941-626-0551                                  .                                                                                     Don’t miss the power, prestige, and family fun of this award-winning event. Join us for a weekend where aviation’s past, present, and future take flight! The Chuters Jump Team to appear at the 2025 Florida International Air Show, Punta Gorda Airport November 1 & 2, 2025 August 29, 2025 PUNTA GORDA, FL —                                               With precision, courage, and patriotic pride, The Chuters Jump Team will thrill thousands of spectators as they soar into Punta Gorda Airport for the Opening Ceremonies of the Florida International Air Show, November 1st and 2nd, 2025.                                                                                                 The Chuters Jump Team is a professional parachute demonstration team, veteran-owned and operated, known for their breathtaking aerial jumps and flawless timing. Their performance will include a dramatic descent carrying the American flag, set against the backdrop of the National Anthem — a moment designed to inspire goosebumps and unite the crowd.                                                                                     “Nothing compares to the silence before the jump and the roar of the crowd when we touch down,” said Keith Walter, Director of Operations and has completed over 6000 jumps. “Being able to open such an incredible event with the American flag is an honor we never take lightly. It’s about celebrating freedom, service, and the thrill of flight.”                                                                                     Organizers say The Chuters set the perfect tone for a weekend filled with world-class aviation.                                                      “The Opening Ceremonies are always a special part of the show, and this year we’re taking it to the next level,” said Denise Dull, President, Florida International Air Show. “When The Chuters come streaming out of the sky, you feel the energy of the entire crowd shift. It’s patriotic. It’s powerful. And it reminds us why we gather to celebrate aviation, service, and community.”                                                                                     The Florida International Air Show has been a tradition in Charlotte County for more than three decades, drawing families, veterans, and aviation enthusiasts from across the United States. This year’s lineup features the U.S. Navy Blue Angels as headliners, along with the Viper F-16 Demo Team, thrilling aerobatic acts, military aircraft demonstrations, and static displays. Food vendors, kids’ activities, and community exhibits will round out a weekend of high-flying fun.                                                                                     “This isn’t just a show — it’s an experience,” added Steve Lineberry, Media and Publicity Director                                  .                                    “The Chuters remind us that aviation is as much about people as it is about planes. Their performance embodies courage, teamwork, and a sense of pride that resonates with everyone in attendance.                                                                                     Event Details:                                              Dates: Saturday, November 1st & Sunday, November 2nd, 2025                        Location: Punta Gorda Airport, Punta Gorda, Florida                        Tickets: On sale now at www.floridaairshow.com Florida International Air Show Set to Soar November 1–2, 2025 Blue Angels, F-16 Viper Demo, and Family Attractions Headline USA TODAY 10BEST Air Show May 9, 2025 Punta Gorda, FL — May 7, 2025                                               — The skies over Southwest Florida will roar to life this fall as the                                              Florida International Air Show                                               returns to                                              Punta Gorda Airport on November 1–2, 2025                                               , with an exhilarating lineup headlined by the                                              U.S. Navy Blue Angels                                               and the                                              F-16 Viper Demo Team                                  .                                                                   This year’s show features a dynamic mix of aerial precision, vintage power, and heart-pounding stunts with performers including                                              Warbird Thunder                                               ,                                              Aarron Deliu                                               ,                                              Doug Litton                                               , and the thrilling parachute team                                              The Chuters                                  .                                                                                                  New for 2025, the Air Show proudly introduces two                                              family-friendly attractions                                  :                                                                   The                                              Innovators STEM Pavilion                                               – a hands-on zone to engage students and families with science, tech, and aviation.                                                                                                              The                                              Family Aviation Experience                                               – a fun, interactive area designed to inspire future aviators and entertain all ages.                                                                                                              Voted a                                              USA TODAY 10BEST Air Show in America for the second consecutive year                                  , this world-class event continues to attract aviation fans, families, and thrill-seekers from across the country.                                                      Tickets go on sale to the public at noon on May 23, 2025                                               . For performer updates, and opportunities to                                              sponsor                                               ,                                              vend                                               , or                                              exhibit                                  , visit www.floridaairshow.com or follow us on social media @florida_air_show.                                                                                     Don’t miss this high-flying celebration of aviation, innovation, and family fun! Apply Now! Deadline for Volunteer Sign-Up is October. We appreciate your interest in working with us during the 2025 FIAS Air Show. This year for volunteer signup we are using an online program called VolunteerLocal for onboarding volunteers and assigning jobs. In this program Volunteer jobs and shifts will be available to choose closer to the Air Show. If you have any trouble navigating the website or finding the jobs you’d like to apply for, please contact the Director of Volunteers, Abby White abbywhite@floridaairshow.com Stay in the Loop, Volunteers & Future Volunteers! Want the latest updates on volunteer opportunities, event details, and behind-the-scenes action? Sign up for our Volunteer Newsletter and be the first to know how you can get involved. * indicates required Email Address * First Name Last Name Meet the Director of Volunteers Abigail White My name is Abigail “Abby” White. I was born and raised in Southwest Florida, growing up with a love for everything outdoors and adventurous. I’ve recently joined the wonderful world of aviation, getting my start with hobby drone flying. This encouraged me to pursue and earn my Part 107 commercial drone license in 2021. This opened a whole new world of opportunity for me. I have since become a private pilot, earning my license right before last year’s air show in November of 2023. I am also a member of our local 99s Women Pilots chapter. I plan on continuing my journey in aviation and making it my career in the future. 2023 was my first year involved with the Air Show, serving as Assistant Director of Volunteers alongside my flight instructor, mentor, and the previous Director of Volunteers Connie Hite. I had an incredible time seeing the show come together and being a part of its production. As Connie moves into another Director role, I am incredibly honored to take over as Director of Volunteers this year. I am looking forward to leading our volunteers through another fun and exciting air show! Feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns you have about volunteering for the 2024 Florida International Air Show! Media Contact:                                              Steve Lineberry                        941-626-0551                        media@floridaairshow.com                        Florida International Air Show                        www.floridaairshow.com Reaching New Heights: Florida International Air Show and conCHAIRto Team Up May 9, 2025 Cleveland, OH – May 2025 – conCHAIRto, the premier provider of premium seating solutions for outdoor music festivals and live events, is pleased to announce a new partnership with the Florida International Air Show (FIAS), scheduled for November 1-2, 2025 in Punta Gorda, Florida.                                                                                                            As a valued partner for this event, conCHAIRto will provide comfortable, convenient and sustainable seating solutions that will allow spectators to comfortably experience the speed, sound and scale that only these aircraft can provide. The schedule includes exciting military and civilian performances and displays for audiences of all ages.                                                                                                            “As we expand our business reach into air show events," said Brett Smiley, President and Founder of conCHAIRto. "I cannot think of a better partner than the Florida International Air Show. They have been exciting audiences for over 43 years and are rated one of the top 10 air show events in the world. We are here to elevate that experience even more.”                                                                                                            The disruptions caused by Hurricanes Milton and Helene forced the cancellation of the 2024 event, the first in its 43-year history. The Florida International Air Show has come back with a bang…or is that a sonic boom? Beginning as a brief single-day event with only a few acts, the show has grown into a multi-day event with family and fan-friendly activities, a large variety of acts, interactive displays and much more. The Punta Gorda Airport plays an integral role in the Air Show’s history — it has hosted the event since its inception.                                                                                                            "We look forward to the November 2025 Air Show hosting the US Navy Blue Angels, where we can provide an amazing event in a way that reflects the strength and resilience of our community," Denise Dull, President of the Air Show.                                                                                                            Tickets for the 2025 Florida International Air Show go on sale on May 23. For more information and to purchase tickets, visit their official website.                                                                                                            About conCHAIRto:                                                      conCHAIRto is a premier provider of high-quality seating solutions, dedicated to enhancing comfort and style for various events and venues. With a focus on innovative design and exceptional craftsmanship, conCHAIRto delivers products that meet the highest standards of excellence.                                                                                                            For more information about conCHAIRto and its range of premium seating solutions, please visit conCHAIRto.com or email us at info@conchairto.com. 2024 FIAS Canceled Due to Hurricanes Milton and Helene October 14, 2024 Air Show Canceled Due to Hurricanes Milton and Helene                                                      [Punta Gorda, FL] –  In light of the significant impacts of Hurricane Milton and Hurricane Helene on the community, organizers have made the difficult decision to cancel the 43rd Annual Florida International Air Show. The dual hurricanes have caused widespread damage and disruption across the region, making it impractical to proceed with the event.                                                                                     "Our community is facing tremendous challenges as we recover from the destruction caused by these two powerful storms," said Denise Dull, President of the Air Show. "The safety of our attendees, vendors, and volunteers is our highest priority, and at this time, it is clear that the best course of action is to focus on supporting our community’s recovery efforts."                                                                                     Both hurricanes have resulted in extensive damage to homes, businesses, and essential infrastructure, with many residents still experiencing the impact of these events. As the region continues its recovery efforts, event organizers believe the community’s attention and resources are best directed toward rebuilding and aiding those affected by the storms.                                                                                     While the Air Show is an annual tradition that brings joy and excitement to the area, the decision to cancel was made out of an abundance of caution and care for the community’s well-being. Organizers are committed to bringing the event back stronger once recovery efforts are complete and the community is ready to come together in celebration.                                                                                     "We are incredibly grateful to our sponsors, volunteers, and vendors who have worked tirelessly in preparation for this year’s event. Our community partners, PGD, Charlotte County Sheriff, Fire & EMS, are all committed to the safety of Charlotte County and its residents and we would not want to do anything that would create a larger burden on their workload during post hurricane rebuild," added Dull. "We look forward to the November 2025 Air Show hosting the US Navy Blue Angels, where we can provide an amazing event in a way that reflects the strength and resilience of our community." Tickets will be refundable or may be exchanged for the 2025 Air Show. *Note the lower ticket price will be honored as we expect ticket prices will increase.                                                                                     For more information on how to assist in relief efforts, please visit www.coadfl.org                                                                                                  About The Florida International Air Show                                                                  The Florida International Air Show’s mission is to deliver a wholesome family entertainment event celebrating aviation past, present, and inspiring its future.                                                                                                  ﻿                        For further information or media inquiries, please contact: Steve Lineberry 941-626-0551 media@floridaairshow.com Experience the thrill of aviation at our award-winning event! October 14, 2024 The Florida International Air Show - This is One Air Show You Do Not Want to Miss! October 1, 2024 Southeast Tourism Society Selects Florida International AirShow  as a  “Signature Event of the Southeast” Award Winner August 12, 2024 PUNTA GORDA, FL. (August 14, 2024) –  Southeast Tourism Society (STS) has named the Florida International Airshow one of the Signature Events of the Southeast for 2024.                                                                                     This year’s Florida International AirShow is November 2-3. 2024 held in Punta Gorda, FL. Signature Events of the Southeast, formerly known as “Top 20 Festival and Event Awards”, was launched as part of the 40th Anniversary celebration of Southeast Tourism Society in 2023. STS has recognized events and festivals around the Southeast since 1985.                                                                                     Travel industry experts select top events to be highlighted for the year, and STS publicizes them throughout the United States. The complete list is published on both the Travel Media Press Room and Escape to the Southeast® websites and recognized on all Southeast Tourism Society’s social media platforms.                                                                                     The AirShow will celebrate its 43rd year of presenting exciting entertainment to residents and visitors of Charlotte County on the grounds of the Punta Gorda Airport. Beginning as a single day event, the show has grown to a three day event with fan-friendly activities, a large variety of acts, interactive displays, and much more. “If you’ve not been to an AirShow before, it’s like taking Nascar, pizza, baseball, hotdogs, fireworks, football and Lynyrd Skynyrd and rolling it all into one giant rodeo “says Denise Dull, President of the Florida International AirShow. “There’s something for everyone in the family.” The Florida International Airshow also received a USA TODAY 10Best Readers Choice Award this year for their November 2023 AirShow, which featured the USAF Thunderbirds and was a record attendance year.                                                                                     “For more than 40 years, STS has been spotlighting the best festivals and events in the Southeast. Our goal is to highlight the efforts of devoted event organizers and provide additional media exposure and accolades for their events,” said Monica Smith, President and CEO of Southeast Tourism Society. “The Southeast offers so many unique, year-round, opportunities for tourists and festival goers to create memories and support the tourism industry-–a vital economic generator for communities.”                                                                                     Events considered for the STS Signature Events of the Southeast recognition must be at least three years old and have an attendance of at least 1,000. Nominations open in early spring. Members and non-members are eligible to apply. Winning submissions are automatically judged in the Festival or Event of the Year category for STS’s Shining Example Awards.                                                                                     About Southeast Tourism Society                                                                   The Southeast Tourism Society (STS) is a not-for-profit membership association dedicated to the development of travel and tourism professionals and organizations within the southeast region. The association’s mission is to empower a diverse network of tourism professionals through Education, Advocacy, Recognition, and Networking. Member states include Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia, plus the District of Columbia.                                                                                                              About Florida International Air Show                                                                               The Florida International AirShow is a Florida 501(c) 4 nonprofit organization staffed entirely by volunteers. The Airshow is a multi day event showcasing nationally known performers and exciting static displays of aircraft and vehicles. The Airshow offers attendees the opportunity to learn more about aviation, space, and military service. FIAS events provide beneficial exposure to the community and Punta Gorda Airport as a significant economic asset has donated over $3.6 million in contributions to local Southwest charities since its inception. Matt Youkin added to the 2023 Performing Line-Up Matt Younkin is a third generation pilot. He is the son of legendary airshow pilot Bobby Younkin, who is famous for his amazing aerobatic displays in the AT-6, Beech 18, Learjet 23, Samson, and most recently, the Super Decathlon. Bobby is considered to be one of the greatest airshow pilots of all time. Matt is also the grandson of Jim Younkin who is well-known for designing the Century and Trutrak autopilots. Jim is also famous for his antique aircraft restorations, as well as building beautiful replicas of the 1930’s air racers such as the Howard “Mr. Mulligan” and the Travel Air “Mystery Ship.” Matt learned to fly at the age of 14 from family friend Ken Collier in a Piper J-3 Cub. At age 15, Chuck Irvin, the same instructor who taught Bobby how to fly, refined Matt’s piloting skills. On his sixteenth birthday, Matt soloed his grandfather’s 1928 Travel Air 4000 biplane. ﻿ Matt is now proficient in over 85 types of airplanes ranging from the Piper Cub to the Boeing B-29. He is also a fully rated flight instructor and now has almost 5,000 hours of total flying time and currently resides in Siloam Springs, AR. The Chuters Jump Team to appear at the 2025 Florida International Air Show, Punta Gorda Airport November 1 & 2, 2025 August 29, 2025 PUNTA GORDA, FL —                                               With precision, courage, and patriotic pride, The Chuters Jump Team will thrill thousands of spectators as they soar into Punta Gorda Airport for the Opening Ceremonies of the Florida International Air Show, November 1st and 2nd, 2025.                                                                                                 The Chuters Jump Team is a professional parachute demonstration team, veteran-owned and operated, known for their breathtaking aerial jumps and flawless timing. Their performance will include a dramatic descent carrying the American flag, set against the backdrop of the National Anthem — a moment designed to inspire goosebumps and unite the crowd.                                                                                     “Nothing compares to the silence before the jump and the roar of the crowd when we touch down,” said Keith Walter, Director of Operations and has completed over 6000 jumps. “Being able to open such an incredible event with the American flag is an honor we never take lightly. It’s about celebrating freedom, service, and the thrill of flight.”                                                                                     Organizers say The Chuters set the perfect tone for a weekend filled with world-class aviation.                                                      “The Opening Ceremonies are always a special part of the show, and this year we’re taking it to the next level,” said Denise Dull, President, Florida International Air Show. “When The Chuters come streaming out of the sky, you feel the energy of the entire crowd shift. It’s patriotic. It’s powerful. And it reminds us why we gather to celebrate aviation, service, and community.”                                                                                     The Florida International Air Show has been a tradition in Charlotte County for more than three decades, drawing families, veterans, and aviation enthusiasts from across the United States. This year’s lineup features the U.S. Navy Blue Angels as headliners, along with the Viper F-16 Demo Team, thrilling aerobatic acts, military aircraft demonstrations, and static displays. Food vendors, kids’ activities, and community exhibits will round out a weekend of high-flying fun.                                                                                     “This isn’t just a show — it’s an experience,” added Steve Lineberry, Media and Publicity Director                                  .                                    “The Chuters remind us that aviation is as much about people as it is about planes. Their performance embodies courage, teamwork, and a sense of pride that resonates with everyone in attendance. As a valued partner for this event, conCHAIRto will provide comfortable, convenient and sustainable seating solutions that will allow spectators to comfortably experience the speed, sound and scale that only these aircraft can provide. "I cannot think of a better partner than the Florida International Air Show. They have been exciting audiences for over 43 years and are rated one of the top 10 air show events in the world. The Florida International Air Show has come back with a bang…or is that a sonic boom? Beginning as a brief single-day event with only a few acts, the show has grown into a multi-day event with family and fan-friendly activities, a large variety of acts, interactive displays and much more. The Punta Gorda Airport plays an integral role in the Air Show’s history — it has hosted the event since its inception.                                                                                                            "We look forward to the November 2025 Air Show hosting the US Navy Blue Angels, where we can provide an amazing event in a way that reflects the strength and resilience of our community," Denise Dull, President of the Air Show.                                                                                                            Tickets for the 2025 Florida International Air Show go on sale on May 23. For more information about conCHAIRto and its range of premium seating solutions, please visit conCHAIRto.com or email us at info@conchairto.com. 2024 FIAS Canceled Due to Hurricanes Milton and Helene October 14, 2024 Air Show Canceled Due to Hurricanes Milton and Helene                                                      [Punta Gorda, FL] –  In light of the significant impacts of Hurricane Milton and Hurricane Helene on the community, organizers have made the difficult decision to cancel the 43rd Annual Florida International Air Show. The dual hurricanes have caused widespread damage and disruption across the region, making it impractical to proceed with the event.                                                                                     "Our community is facing tremendous challenges as we recover from the destruction caused by these two powerful storms," said Denise Dull, President of the Air Show. "The safety of our attendees, vendors, and volunteers is our highest priority, and at this time, it is clear that the best course of action is to focus on supporting our community’s recovery efforts."                                                                                     Both hurricanes have resulted in extensive damage to homes, businesses, and essential infrastructure, with many residents still experiencing the impact of these events. As the region continues its recovery efforts, event organizers believe the community’s attention and resources are best directed toward rebuilding and aiding those affected by the storms.                                                                                     While the Air Show is an annual tradition that brings joy and excitement to the area, the decision to cancel was made out of an abundance of caution and care for the community’s well-being. Organizers are committed to bringing the event back stronger once recovery efforts are complete and the community is ready to come together in celebration.                                                                                     "We are incredibly grateful to our sponsors, volunteers, and vendors who have worked tirelessly in preparation for this year’s event. Our community partners, PGD, Charlotte County Sheriff, Fire & EMS, are all committed to the safety of Charlotte County and its residents and we would not want to do anything that would create a larger burden on their workload during post hurricane rebuild," added Dull. "We look forward to the November 2025 Air Show hosting the US Navy Blue Angels, where we can provide an amazing event in a way that reflects the strength and resilience of our community." Tickets will be refundable or may be exchanged for the 2025 Air Show. *Note the lower ticket price will be honored as we expect ticket prices will increase. October 1, 2024 Southeast Tourism Society Selects Florida International AirShow  as a  “Signature Event of the Southeast” Award Winner August 12, 2024 PUNTA GORDA, FL. (August 14, 2024) –  Southeast Tourism Society (STS) has named the Florida International Airshow one of the Signature Events of the Southeast for 2024.                                                                                     This year’s Florida International AirShow is November 2-3. 2024 held in Punta Gorda, FL. Signature Events of the Southeast, formerly known as “Top 20 Festival and Event Awards”, was launched as part of the 40th Anniversary celebration of Southeast Tourism Society in 2023. STS has recognized events and festivals around the Southeast since 1985.                                                                                     Travel industry experts select top events to be highlighted for the year, and STS publicizes them throughout the United States. The complete list is published on both the Travel Media Press Room and Escape to the Southeast® websites and recognized on all Southeast Tourism Society’s social media platforms.                                                                                     The AirShow will celebrate its 43rd year of presenting exciting entertainment to residents and visitors of Charlotte County on the grounds of the Punta Gorda Airport. Beginning as a single day event, the show has grown to a three day event with fan-friendly activities, a large variety of acts, interactive displays, and much more. “If you’ve not been to an AirShow before, it’s like taking Nascar, pizza, baseball, hotdogs, fireworks, football and Lynyrd Skynyrd and rolling it all into one giant rodeo “says Denise Dull, President of the Florida International AirShow. “There’s something for everyone in the family.” The Florida International Airshow also received a USA TODAY 10Best Readers Choice Award this year for their November 2023 AirShow, which featured the USAF Thunderbirds and was a record attendance year.                                                                                     “For more than 40 years, STS has been spotlighting the best festivals and events in the Southeast. Our goal is to highlight the efforts of devoted event organizers and provide additional media exposure and accolades for their events,” said Monica Smith, President and CEO of Southeast Tourism Society. “The Southeast offers so many unique, year-round, opportunities for tourists and festival goers to create memories and support the tourism industry-–a vital economic generator for communities.”                                                                                     Events considered for the STS Signature Events of the Southeast recognition must be at least three years old and have an attendance of at least 1,000. Nominations open in early spring. Members and non-members are eligible to apply. Winning submissions are automatically judged in the Festival or Event of the Year category for STS’s Shining Example Awards.                                                                                     About Southeast Tourism Society                                                                   The Southeast Tourism Society (STS) is a not-for-profit membership association dedicated to the development of travel and tourism professionals and organizations within the southeast region. The association’s mission is to empower a diverse network of tourism professionals through Education, Advocacy, Recognition, and Networking. Member states include Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia, plus the District of Columbia.                                                                                                              About Florida International Air Show                                                                               The Florida International AirShow is a Florida 501(c) 4 nonprofit organization staffed entirely by volunteers. The Airshow is a multi day event showcasing nationally known performers and exciting static displays of aircraft and vehicles. The Airshow offers attendees the opportunity to learn more about aviation, space, and military service. FIAS events provide beneficial exposure to the community and Punta Gorda Airport as a significant economic asset has donated over $3.6 million in contributions to local Southwest charities since its inception. Cape Canaveral Air Force Station Home / Why Florida / Florida’s Major Industries / Aviation & Aerospace Where Aviation & Aerospace Companies Lift Off With a rich supply chain and top connectivity, Florida’s aviation and aerospace companies are shooting for the stars. Home to the renowned Kennedy Space Center , Cecil Spaceport and Cape Canaveral Air Force Station , Florida’s aviation and aerospace industry is the world’s gateway to space. As the birthplace of commercial aviation, Florida has 125 public-use airports and 19 commercial airports to seamlessly move goods and people around the globe. The Sunshine State is the undisputed air traffic hub of the Americas, a major hub for flight training and MRO and a leading location for manufacturing aircrafts and aircraft components. In addition, Florida has the rich supply chain and highly skilled workforce to support engineering, robotics, surveillance, technology and more. And, did you ever try to read a program book and walk? We have the solution—SUN ‘n FUN Radio! SUN ‘n FUN Radio Broadcasts locally on 1510 AM & audio streams worldwide on www.LiveATC.net/snf . Tune in… We will keep you updated on scheduled events as well as special activities, and guests for the day.Tune in to hear our RadioActive volunteer announcers & reporters bring you interviews with a variety of interesting pilots, builders, aviation enthusiasts, and SUN ‘n FUN exhibitors, sponsors & advertisers, as well as weather updates and major news stories. We also broadcast the daily airshow commentary & select evening programs. Please “Like” our Facebook Page www.Facebook.com/SnFRadio You can also follow us on Twitter www.Twitter.com/SnFRadio Or you can email us at SnFRadio@gmail.com × SUN ‘n FUN Media Productions and SUN ‘n FUN Aerospace Expo TV Media Productions at SUN ‘n FUN is the Aerospace Center for Excellence’s in-house media gathering team. Production facilities are wholly located within the company’s headquarters. Producing 4K and HD broadcast video assets promotes the organization’s activities across all areas, from the fly-in to education. Established in 2023 for SUN ‘n FUN, an all-volunteer team produces Live Streaming of television programming, short and long-form video features, and marketing assets for use by the Aerospace Center for Excellence. In 2024, the Media productions Team: Acquired more than 4.3 terabytes (TB) of video footage Produced more than 20 hours of Live Television Produced 249 video programs, features, or shorts While this is a volunteer team, members of Media Productions bring more than 70 years of broadcast production experience to the event. This spirit of volunteering and professionalism is the hallmark of the history of SUN ‘n FUN. Available Assets and Programming During the SUN ‘n FUN fly-in, Media Productions is actively videotaping multiple events that occur on campus. Requests for footage should be made to Dave Kalahar at dkalahar@flysnf.org Live Events can be captured via a Boxcast URL.  Contact Dave Kalahar for details. The ACE/SNF broadcast studio may be available for outside production. Our fully equipped multi-camera studio is capable of 4K and HD production. Contact Dave Kalahar for details and availability. Volunteer Opportunities Media Productions is always looking for volunteers to help with its work. We need video editors, field camera operators, studio production assistants, and on-camera hosts or reporters. Full details are available at https://volunteer.flysnf.org/volunteer-job-listings/ . We look forward to having you join the team. × 2025 STOL FORUMS Registration for presentations that are scheduled in the STOL Bushwheel Basecamp. Δ × 2025 FORUMS SPEAKER REGISTRATION " * " indicates required fields Are You Interested in Presenting a Forum during SUN ‘n FUN Aerospace Expo 2025? You are invited to contribute to the diverse offerings of aviation-related topics throughout the week of SUN ‘n FUN providing our guests with the opportunity to enjoy various educational opportunities.  Our presentations provide information on everything from A to Z. A presenter may not promote or sell any product or service during the scheduled presentation. EDUCATIONAL FORUMS cannot be used in place of an exhibit space purchase, this is strictly an educational opportunity for our guests to experience. If you are knowledgeable on an aviation topic and would like to share with your fellow aviators and SUN ‘n FUN guests, please complete the form below. Please do not use “quote marks” in your submission title. Once we begin compiling the schedule, we will contact you if we have questions regarding your topic or schedule request. Once you have submitted your registration successfully, you will receive an email confirming your submission. Please make sure the email provided on the registration is accurate.  If a confirmation email is not received, SUN ‘n FUN did not receive your submission. Please check your junk mail, try another browser or method to resubmit your registration. After trying all the above suggestions with no results, please contact us. Enjoy the airshow up close and personal… The Preferred Airshow Seating Area is north of the Manufactured Display exhibit area and west of the chalets along the airshow line. Your purchase will provide access to seating, restrooms, some shade (not all areas are shaded), bag storage, and complimentary water during the daily airshow. Food and beverages, including beer, will also be available for purchase! If you plan to experience the Preferred Seating area, there is no need to bring your chairs, they are provided. Umbrellas are NOT permitted. Single Day Preferred Airshow Seating can be purchased online, please make sure you choose the ticket for the day you intend to be at SUN ‘n FUN. Preferred Airshow Seating tickets are day-specific and will be honored for the day purchased only. Night Airshows: Purchase of a $35 ticket (per person) allows for all-day access to the Preferred Seating Area, including the night airshows on Wednesday and Saturday nights. Regular tram schedules are unavailable after 8 p.m. – Preferred Seating Area does not provide seating for the Tuesday night concert that will be held on the Warbird ramp. Entry to the Preferred Airshow Seating for Children 6 and under is free, however, all guests are required to have a convention admission wristband, including children 6 and under. × Preferred Photo Seating Purchase of SUN ‘n FUN Event Admission is also required.) New Location – Northeast side of Warbird Ramp Exclusive Photo Area with access to elevated bleachers providing unobstructed photo shooting opportunities. Preferred Photo Seating Area does not include any benefits for the Tuesday night concert. This Preferred Photo Seating area is for flightline and daytime airshow viewing only. × What’s Included In Your SUN ‘n FUN Single Day or Weekly Ticket? Opening Day Concert Daily Airshow Wednesday / Saturday Night Airshow & Fireworks Celebration Access to the Showplanes on the Flightline Over 500 Aviation-Focused Exhibitors Static Military Aircraft and Demonstration Flights Access to the Pilot Welcome Center Fly-By Showcase Educational & FAA Forums, Workshops, and Seminars Museum Lectures Evening Movies and entertainment programs Shuttle Transportation throughout the Campus Admission to the Florida Air Museum Access to the Jerry Holland Aviation Playground Daily aircraft parking × Member Admission Purchase SUN ‘n FUN provides general admission ticket discounts to individuals who are current members or belong to any of these Aviation Member Associations, Chapters, or Groups listed below. SUN ‘n FUN has provided each Aviation Member Association, Chapter or Group with a unique discount code for their members. This discount code is required to purchase member-discounted admission tickets online (this includes FAM and EAA). A member ID card is required at the ticket window for an on-site redemption or purchase. Members can purchase one additional single-day or weekly ticket at the member’s rate. Additional admission tickets are available for purchase at the non-member rate. This code will NOT discount camping or any upgraded ticket, discounts apply to general admission tickets only! The Chuters Jump Team to appear at the 2025 Florida International Air Show, Punta Gorda Airport November 1 & 2, 2025 August 29, 2025 PUNTA GORDA, FL —                                               With precision, courage, and patriotic pride, The Chuters Jump Team will thrill thousands of spectators as they soar into Punta Gorda Airport for the Opening Ceremonies of the Florida International Air Show, November 1st and 2nd, 2025.                                                                                                 The Chuters Jump Team is a professional parachute demonstration team, veteran-owned and operated, known for their breathtaking aerial jumps and flawless timing. Their performance will include a dramatic descent carrying the American flag, set against the backdrop of the National Anthem — a moment designed to inspire goosebumps and unite the crowd.                                                                                     “Nothing compares to the silence before the jump and the roar of the crowd when we touch down,” said Keith Walter, Director of Operations and has completed over 6000 jumps. “Being able to open such an incredible event with the American flag is an honor we never take lightly. It’s about celebrating freedom, service, and the thrill of flight.”                                                                                     Organizers say The Chuters set the perfect tone for a weekend filled with world-class aviation.                                                      “The Opening Ceremonies are always a special part of the show, and this year we’re taking it to the next level,” said Denise Dull, President, Florida International Air Show. “When The Chuters come streaming out of the sky, you feel the energy of the entire crowd shift. It’s patriotic. It’s powerful. And it reminds us why we gather to celebrate aviation, service, and community.”                                                                                     The Florida International Air Show has been a tradition in Charlotte County for more than three decades, drawing families, veterans, and aviation enthusiasts from across the United States. This year’s lineup features the U.S. Navy Blue Angels as headliners, along with the Viper F-16 Demo Team, thrilling aerobatic acts, military aircraft demonstrations, and static displays. Food vendors, kids’ activities, and community exhibits will round out a weekend of high-flying fun.                                                                                     “This isn’t just a show — it’s an experience,” added Steve Lineberry, Media and Publicity Director                                  .                                    “The Chuters remind us that aviation is as much about people as it is about planes. Their performance embodies courage, teamwork, and a sense of pride that resonates with everyone in attendance. For more information about conCHAIRto and its range of premium seating solutions, please visit conCHAIRto.com or email us at info@conchairto.com. 2024 FIAS Canceled Due to Hurricanes Milton and Helene October 14, 2024 Air Show Canceled Due to Hurricanes Milton and Helene                                                      [Punta Gorda, FL] –  In light of the significant impacts of Hurricane Milton and Hurricane Helene on the community, organizers have made the difficult decision to cancel the 43rd Annual Florida International Air Show. The dual hurricanes have caused widespread damage and disruption across the region, making it impractical to proceed with the event.                                                                                     "Our community is facing tremendous challenges as we recover from the destruction caused by these two powerful storms," said Denise Dull, President of the Air Show. "The safety of our attendees, vendors, and volunteers is our highest priority, and at this time, it is clear that the best course of action is to focus on supporting our community’s recovery efforts."                                                                                     Both hurricanes have resulted in extensive damage to homes, businesses, and essential infrastructure, with many residents still experiencing the impact of these events. As the region continues its recovery efforts, event organizers believe the community’s attention and resources are best directed toward rebuilding and aiding those affected by the storms.                                                                                     While the Air Show is an annual tradition that brings joy and excitement to the area, the decision to cancel was made out of an abundance of caution and care for the community’s well-being. Organizers are committed to bringing the event back stronger once recovery efforts are complete and the community is ready to come together in celebration.                                                                                     "We are incredibly grateful to our sponsors, volunteers, and vendors who have worked tirelessly in preparation for this year’s event. Our community partners, PGD, Charlotte County Sheriff, Fire & EMS, are all committed to the safety of Charlotte County and its residents and we would not want to do anything that would create a larger burden on their workload during post hurricane rebuild," added Dull. "We look forward to the November 2025 Air Show hosting the US Navy Blue Angels, where we can provide an amazing event in a way that reflects the strength and resilience of our community." Tickets will be refundable or may be exchanged for the 2025 Air Show. *Note the lower ticket price will be honored as we expect ticket prices will increase. October 1, 2024 Southeast Tourism Society Selects Florida International AirShow  as a  “Signature Event of the Southeast” Award Winner August 12, 2024 PUNTA GORDA, FL. (August 14, 2024) –  Southeast Tourism Society (STS) has named the Florida International Airshow one of the Signature Events of the Southeast for 2024.                                                                                     This year’s Florida International AirShow is November 2-3. 2024 held in Punta Gorda, FL. Signature Events of the Southeast, formerly known as “Top 20 Festival and Event Awards”, was launched as part of the 40th Anniversary celebration of Southeast Tourism Society in 2023. STS has recognized events and festivals around the Southeast since 1985.                                                                                     Travel industry experts select top events to be highlighted for the year, and STS publicizes them throughout the United States. The complete list is published on both the Travel Media Press Room and Escape to the Southeast® websites and recognized on all Southeast Tourism Society’s social media platforms.                                                                                     The AirShow will celebrate its 43rd year of presenting exciting entertainment to residents and visitors of Charlotte County on the grounds of the Punta Gorda Airport. Beginning as a single day event, the show has grown to a three day event with fan-friendly activities, a large variety of acts, interactive displays, and much more. “If you’ve not been to an AirShow before, it’s like taking Nascar, pizza, baseball, hotdogs, fireworks, football and Lynyrd Skynyrd and rolling it all into one giant rodeo “says Denise Dull, President of the Florida International AirShow. “There’s something for everyone in the family.” The Florida International Airshow also received a USA TODAY 10Best Readers Choice Award this year for their November 2023 AirShow, which featured the USAF Thunderbirds and was a record attendance year.                                                                                     “For more than 40 years, STS has been spotlighting the best festivals and events in the Southeast. Our goal is to highlight the efforts of devoted event organizers and provide additional media exposure and accolades for their events,” said Monica Smith, President and CEO of Southeast Tourism Society. “The Southeast offers so many unique, year-round, opportunities for tourists and festival goers to create memories and support the tourism industry-–a vital economic generator for communities.”                                                                                     Events considered for the STS Signature Events of the Southeast recognition must be at least three years old and have an attendance of at least 1,000. Nominations open in early spring. Members and non-members are eligible to apply. Winning submissions are automatically judged in the Festival or Event of the Year category for STS’s Shining Example Awards.                                                                                     About Southeast Tourism Society                                                                   The Southeast Tourism Society (STS) is a not-for-profit membership association dedicated to the development of travel and tourism professionals and organizations within the southeast region. The association’s mission is to empower a diverse network of tourism professionals through Education, Advocacy, Recognition, and Networking. Member states include Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia, plus the District of Columbia.                                                                                                              About Florida International Air Show                                                                               The Florida International AirShow is a Florida 501(c) 4 nonprofit organization staffed entirely by volunteers. The Airshow is a multi day event showcasing nationally known performers and exciting static displays of aircraft and vehicles. The Airshow offers attendees the opportunity to learn more about aviation, space, and military service. FIAS events provide beneficial exposure to the community and Punta Gorda Airport as a significant economic asset has donated over $3.6 million in contributions to local Southwest charities since its inception.
